title: LeaverBuster Problems
body: OK. So for the past few days, my laptop has been restarting on it's own free will. While I am mid game. After a few times of being behind and stuff, League puts me in LeaverBuster. Since it was only 5 minutes, I was ok with that. Now, it's up to 20 minutes. I recently just finished 5 queues of 20 minutes on LeaverBuster and just now, my laptop restart again. Mid game. Not only am I going to get reported for leaving the game early, but I am on 120 minutes of LeaverBuster. Are you serious? None of this is my fault (Maybe). My laptop is restarting on it's own. I am running Windows 10 on a Dell Inspiron 5565. I don't know why this occurs. Can Riot please add in a feature in the next patch/update where players can submit a form so we can explain why we left early? Thanks if you actually read this.

replies.body:
It is your fault sadly, you continue to play knowing your laptop will shut off. 
RIOT says that ruins other players experience.
IF riot did allow a form that did that, imagine how many AFK'ers would use that excuse.

As to why your laptop is cutting off, here's a few possible reasons:
Battery is loose.
Charger is loose.
Check task manager, you may be running too many programs and LoL just overloads it.
Battery could be faulty.

Regardless of your intent, your absence from a match negatively impacts **everyone**. This is a huge reason why the system treats all disconnections equally and why we cannot modify [**Leaverbuster**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) penalties for any reason.

Random PC reboots are not a good sign and can often mean there are either driver issues or hardware failure going on. I strongly recommend working through our [**Bugsplat & Crash Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes) to check up on your hardware. Please let me know if these steps helped.
